instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no video
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no video. I can hear the chime, but I have no image, even in external display.

Already disabled GPU with medusa but with the same result.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no video
threads.message:
First on this model is resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.
GPU doesn't fail as much as other models.

Disabling GPU lose external video!
I'm not sure if Medusa works on this machine model.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no video
threads.message:
Hi,

tks. I didn't know that about this model.

After resoldering <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, it worked a few times. But after reassembling the machine it stoped working again.

Should I replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no video
threads.message:
You can try that.
If problem still persist, then disable GPU.
Not a dificult job; only need few bypasses.
Don't forget to force backlight adjust signal also; to avoid wake from sleep issue.
